snippet: A live HD broadcast of “The Bright Stream” from the Bolshoi Ballet, showed off the company’s comedic talent in new ways.
abstract: Alastair Macaulay reviews live HD broadcast of Alexei Ratmansky ballet The Bright Stream, performed by the Bolshoi Ballet in Moscow. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: Maybe one day American ballet companies will catch up with those of Russia and Britain in their new wave of international live HD broadcasts of their productions. I watched with pleasure when the Royal Ballet's ''Romeo and Juliet'' was screened in March, but one part of me also dreams of a time when British ballet fans can go to the cinema to see how American Ballet Theater dances that Kenneth MacMillan production -- no less well, in general, and perhaps better, with some casts. Many companies in different countries and different cities are dancing the same ballets. Only a few travelers have any idea of how they compare, especially now that the touring of ballet companies, with live music, is becoming increasingly pricey. Broadcasts could serve as a bridge.

headline.main: Live From Moscow, Adulterers And a Ballerina With a Hairy Chest
